entry.title: Warriors link with Ireland RL
entry.summary:
Wigan Warriors have formed a link with Rugby League Ireland

The post Warriors link with Ireland RL appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
Wigan Warriors have linked with Rugby League Ireland in a partnership with Community Club Loughshinny RLFC.

Wigan Warriors Community Foundation are starting to deliver Rugby League in Ireland in a bid to increase participation within the game over the water. Staff from the Community Foundation recently visited Loughshinny, a coastal village in northern County Dublin, the first Community Club in Ireland to become part of the ambassador project.

Head of the Community Foundation,¬†Martin McLoughlin,¬†said: ‚ÄúWorking with Ireland RL and¬†Loughshinny¬†RLFC is another powerful statement of the aspirations of Wigan Warriors and its¬†Community¬†Foundation. We¬†hope to generate a positive presence, profile and brand through strategic delivery in areas of potential growth. If we can provide schools and clubs with the fundamentals to increase community engagement it allows us to reach out to new fans and new participants.‚Äù¬†

During the visit they attended schools and the local Rugby League Clubs facilities to share future partnership plans that will see Wigan Warriors coaches deliver Rugby League through a host of fun school holiday camps, development day performance sessions and coach education workshops for all teachers and coaches.‚ÄØ 

Wigan Warriors community club ambassadors programme is fully committed to supporting all 21 local community clubs that are involved in the new 2022 program and any other clubs that have an interest to be involved and seek professional support with their club‚Äôs future development. 

This new and exciting partnership will complement those efforts and support the growth of the grassroots game and also give young aspiring rugby players a clear pathway with Wigan Warriors. The visit was the first of many to Ireland that will engage with so many Irish rugby league enthusiasts & in return we are looking forward to welcoming Loughshinny and Ireland Rugby League to a Wigan Warriors home fixture in 2022.‚ÄØ 

Rory O’Hara of Loughshinny RL said: ‚ÄúLoughshinny Rugby League Club and St Brendan‚Äôs School Rugby League were delighted to host Wigan Warriors. This partnership strengthens Wigan‚Äôs connection with our Irish fans not just in Ireland but with the wider Irish Rugby League diasporas around the world particularly in Australia and New Zealand, while also providing a clear pathway for young Irish players both in Loughshinny and in Ireland as a whole to participate in Rugby League and take up all the advantages and knowledge that being an ambassador to the Wigan Warriors entails!‚Äù

In addition, Chairman of Rugby League Ireland, Jim Reynolds, said:

‚ÄúI am delighted that Wigan Warriors have chosen to bring this first-in-Ireland partnership between a local Club for junior RL players and coaches directly into their outstanding Ambassador programme ‚Äì their first outside of England.‚ÄØ 

Growing Junior RL is one of the major pillars of the RLI Five Year Strategic Plan, that we launched three months ago, to build and sustain our great sport in Ireland for the decades to come.‚ÄØCongratulations‚ÄØto all involved!‚Äù 

See our full gallery from the visit below. If your club would like to be involved in this exclusive ambassadors programme please contact‚ÄØd.fullerton@wiganwarriors.com‚ÄØ 

 

The post Warriors link with Ireland RL appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.

entry.title: Smithies: Kicking on
entry.summary:
Morgan Smithies looks ahead to the 2022 season

The post Smithies: Kicking on appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
• Morgan Smithies looks ahead to the 2022 season in an interview with Wigan TV.
  • Smithies: “I‚Äôm not really a young lad anymore so I think I need to start showing that on the pitch.‚Äù
  • Watch the full interview on Wigan TV, not a subscriber? Click HERE to join today!

Morgan Smithies caught up with Wigan TV to discuss returning from the Christmas break, pre-season friendlies and the upcoming season.

‚ÄúNice little 10-day break over Christmas but it‚Äôs good to be back now with the boys. Everyone has had a nice break but everyone was very keen and eager to get back,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúI spent Christmas with my family and friends, spent some time with my friends back at home which was nice but now I‚Äôm back over in Wigan and looking forward to kicking on with my Rugby.‚Äù

The squad all returned from the Christmas break and have two pre-season fixtures on the horizon: ‚ÄúYeah that‚Äôs the good thing about coming back after Christmas, you‚Äôve got the games to look forward to, we‚Äôve only got a few weeks worth of training and then we‚Äôre into the games which everyone is buzzing for, I can‚Äôt wait to get back out there with the lads.‚Äù

Smithies is well accustomed to Matt Peet as a Coach and has enjoyed his approach so far: ‚ÄúFrom playing at Scholarship I always thought Matt would one day get Head Coach at Wigan, Matt has had a big influence on my career and I‚Äôm chuffed for him getting the Head Coach role. I think he fully deserves it and I think he‚Äôll do well.

“I‚Äôd say there‚Äôs been a big culture change, about what we do away from the training ground, about what we do inside these four walls, just being better blokes and more importantly just back enjoying our rugby I think. It‚Äôs been really good so far.‚Äù

Smithies enters another season with the Warriors and has high hopes to improve his game: ‚Äú100%, I‚Äôm 21 now and I‚Äôve got over 50 games under my belt so I think this year I really need to kick on. I‚Äôm not really a young lad anymore so I think I need to start showing that on the pitch.

‚ÄúThe past two seasons have been a bit average, my first season was alright then after that it‚Äôs just been a bit average but this year I‚Äôm really looking forward to kicking on with my rugby.‚Äù

Make it Wigan in 2022 and celebrate our 150th year with a Wigan Warriors season ticket. Supporting Wigan is about more than just going to a game. It‚Äôs about something bigger, something special. Its about playing our own individual role in helping the Club succeed. Buy your season ticket today. Click HERE for all the details.




The post Smithies: Kicking on appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.

entry.title: Sutton & Nicholson go out on loan
entry.summary:
Youngsters head to Newcastle to play in the Betfred Championship

The post Sutton & Nicholson go out on loan appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
Wigan Warriors can confirm that youngsters Alex Sutton and Matty Nicholson have both signed for Betfred Championship side Newcastle Thunder on loan deals.

Sutton, 19, and Nicholson, 18, were both given senior squad numbers with Wigan for the first time in the off-season and have now joined Newcastle to gain first team experience.

There is a call-back option in Wigan’s favour for both players to return to the Club throughout 2022 if required.

Head of Youth, Darrell Goulding, said: “It‚Äôs a really good experience for them getting to play at a high level in the Championship and will help accelerate their development. Newcastle have a very good set up and will make the lads feel welcome. We look forward to watching them progress.”

Both players have been involved in the Warriors’ pre-season preparations ahead of the loan agreement.

Sutton joined Wigan’s Scholarship system having started playing Rugby League with Widnes Moorfield. He has since progressed through the Academy and featured heavily for the Warriors’ Under-19s team in 2021.

On making the move to Newcastle, Sutton said: “I‚Äôm looking forward to being at Thunder and working hard to keep getting experience. I‚Äôve been introduced to the first team at Wigan this year and have been involved in pre-season, but I‚Äôm coming on loan to hopefully gain some experience.”

Nicholson returns to Thunder having played for the North East side in a game against Bradford Bulls in August 2021 on a short-term deal.

The second rower / loose forward started his Rugby League journey at Siddal ARLFC and went on to join Wigan’s Scholarship programme aged 14. Progressing through the Academy ranks, Nicholson was named the Warriors Under-16s Player of the Year in 2019 and has been a key player for the Under-19s side.

“Coming back on loan to Thunder will hopefully give me an opportunity to play a good standard of rugby consistently to keep trying on improving my game,” he said.

“I was here for one game last season and the boys were a good set of lads to be around. It was a big step up from playing Academy Rugby League but it was a good experience that I enjoyed and I‚Äôm hoping to be able to get more of that this season.”

The post Sutton & Nicholson go out on loan appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.

entry.title: Four Warriors in England performance squad
entry.summary:
Four Warriors Women have been named in the England Performance Squad for 2022

The post Four Warriors in England performance squad appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
England Women have named their 31-player performance squad in preparation for the Rugby League World Cup, with four Warriors Women included.

England Women Head Coach Craig Richards has selected a 31-strong National Performance Squad as preparations for the Rugby League World Cup this autumn continues, with the group meeting for the first time in 2022 on Saturday 15 January at Weetwood Sports Park, Leeds.

Wigan’s Rebecca Greenfield, Vicky Molyneux, Rachel Thompson and Georgia Wilson have all been included in the performance squad.

Leeds Rhinos hooker Keara Bennett has been introduced to the squad following impressive showings for the Rhinos culminating in a Betfred Women‚Äôs Super League Grand Final appearance last season. 

The Rhinos provide eight players including off-season signings Emma Lumley and 2018 Woman of Steel Georgia Roche. Hollie Dodd ‚Äì who made her international debut last season ‚Äì and Tara Stanley are both also named after leaving Castleford Tigers for York City Knights ahead of the 2022 season. 

2021 treble-winners St Helens have 12 players included in the squad including reigning Woman of Steel Jodie Cunningham and England captain Emily Rudge. Saints trio Beth Stott, Paige Travis and Rachael Woosey all made their international debuts last year and are included. 

Experienced international Shona Hoyle represents Huddersfield Giants following their promotion to Group 1 of the BWSL in 2022.

England Women Head Coach Craig Richards said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really pleased to have named our first National Performance Squad in a World Cup year. 

‚ÄúThe majority of the players included have been in or around the programme for some time now and I feel we have some real quality amongst the squad. 

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great to have been able to add Keara Bennett to the squad after she consistently performed for Leeds throughout 2021. We had several international debutants last season and there are certainly going to be opportunities for players to break into the side before the World Cup. 

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been building towards this World Cup for a number of years now, but we know how crucial our preparations over the next nine months are going to be.‚Äù 

England Women will begin their Rugby League World Cup campaign against Brazil at Headingley Stadium on Tuesday 1 November. A clash with Canada at Wigan‚Äôs DW Stadium on Saturday 5 November is followed by a final group stage fixture back in Leeds against Papua New Guinea on Wednesday 9 November.

The RFL are looking to finalise a mid-season international programme which will see England Women take to the field before this year‚Äôs Rugby League World Cup

England Women National Performance Squad: 

Dannielle Anderson (Leeds Rhinos) 
Savannah Andrade (York City Knights) 
Caitlin Beevers (Leeds Rhinos) 
Keara Bennett (Leeds Rhinos) 
Leah Burke (St Helens) 
Chantelle Crowl (St Helens) 
Jodie Cunningham (St Helens) 
Hollie Dodd (York City Knights) 
Grace Field (York City Knights) 
Kelsey Gentles (York City Knights) 
Fran Goldthorp (Leeds Rhinos) 
Rebecca Greenfield (Wigan Warriors) 
Amy Hardcastle (St Helens) 
Shona Hoyle (Huddersfield Giants) 
Amy Johnson (Leeds Rhinos) 
Tara Jones (St Helens) 
Chloe Kerrigan (Leeds Rhinos) 
Emma Lumley (Leeds Rhinos) 
Vicky Molyneux (Wigan Warriors) 
Carrie Roberts (St Helens)  
Georgia Roche (Leeds Rhinos) 
Emily Rudge (St Helens) 
Tara Stanley (York City Knights) 
Beth Stott (St Helens) 
Rachel Thompson (Wigan Warriors) 
Paige Travis (St Helens) 
Vicky Whitfield (St Helens) 
Naomi Williams (St Helens) 
Georgia Wilson (Wigan Warriors) 
Olivia Wood (York City Knights) 
Rachael Woosey (St Helens)

The post Four Warriors in England performance squad appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.

entry.title: Lotto 10k Draw LIVE
entry.summary:
The latest ¬£10,000 Draw will take place LIVE on Facebook on Tuesday 11th January

The post Lotto 10k Draw LIVE appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
The latest Wigan Warriors Lotto ¬£10,000 Draw will take place LIVE on Facebook on Tuesday 11th January.

Hosted by winger Liam Marshall the Jackpot Draw will be live streamed on the Wigan Warriors Facebook page at 4:30pm and second rower Liam Farrell will push the button to start the process of selecting the latest ¬£10,000 winner.¬†

Click HERE to go to our Facebook page.

This is the first ¬£10,000 Draw in 2022, one of two ¬£10k Draws that take place every year.

Lotto members who pay ¬£1 every week are automatically entered into this draw and stand a chance of becoming ¬£10,000 better off. 

Warriors Lotto

Wigan Warriors Lotto has recently moved its weekly draw announcements onto the Club‚Äôs main social media pages, for more accessibility to fans. Not involved with Lotto? Click HERE to find out more or read below for all the information:

The Wigan Warriors Lotto Draw is a members‚Äô lottery, supporting Youth Development of Rugby League and in particular Youth Development at Wigan Warriors so it can continue its fabulous record of producing young stars who go on to represent the Club and in some cases even their Country.

There is an opportunity to win some fantastic cash prizes every week, 52 weeks of the year! It is open to anyone over the age of 16 and you are not limited to just one set of numbers weekly you may buy multiples.

What Can I win?

Weekly

Every week you can win any of these prizes:

  • 1st Prize ‚Äì ¬£1,000
  • 2nd Prize ‚Äì ¬£200
  • 3rd Prize ‚Äì ¬£150
  • 4th Prize ‚Äì ¬£100
  • 5th Prize ‚Äì ¬£100
  • 6th Prize ‚Äì ¬£50
  • 7th Prize ‚Äì ¬£50

There are also a host of ¬£10 consolation prizes paid out to members with the same winning combination of numbers but a different prefix letter as any weekly prize above. Draws are made electronically by a random number generator.

Half Yearly

There are also two Super Jackpots of ¬£10,000 and these are drawn half-yearly on dates to be advertised on our social media channels. The next ¬£10,000 Jackpot draw will be made on Tuesday 11th January 2022. Please note that the deadline has now passed for new members to be eligible for Tuesday’s ¬£10k Draw.

Rollover Jackpot

In addition to the main draw each week we also have a draw known as our Rollover Jackpot Draw ‚Äìstarting at ¬£100, four numbers are drawn and if they match with a members combination then that person wins the prize that is the current Rollover that week and the Rollover is then reset to ¬£100, but it if no one holds that combination ¬£100 is added to the prize all the way up to a maximum of ¬£7,500 when it is then drawn until sold ‚Äì next week the Rollover Jackpot is ¬£200.

How do I play?

For just ¬£1 per week, you will receive a Lotto membership card containing your ten sets of draw numbers, each with a prefix letter.

The simplest way to join is by DIRECT DEBIT by following this link ‚Äì FastDD  Please note that this shows on your bank statement as a payment to DEBIT FINANCE, this is the company we use to collect the membership fees on our behalf. You can also join by standing order (please ask for a standing order form) or you can pay either 6 months (¬£26) or 12 months (¬£52) in advance by cheque payable to Wigan warriors Development Association.  

If your prefix letter and four following numbers are drawn, you will win one of our top seven prizes. As mentioned above, ¬£10 consolation prizes are paid to all paid-up members with same winning combination of numbers but a different prefix letter as any of the seven main prizes.

No claim is necessary. All winners are notified automatically and the winning numbers are also advertised on the Lotto section of Wigan Warriors’ website each Monday, on the Club‚Äôs Twitter feed @WiganWarriorsRL, and on weekly results sheets delivered by our agents or available from the Warriors Lotto Office.

We are always looking for new members to join Lotto. If you are not a member, please join, and if you know of anyone who would like to join and they are over the age of 16 you can recommend them to us.

Please phone 01942 231321 for further details or email lotto@wiganwarriors.com. Members must be 16 years of age or over. It is illegal to gamble under the age of 16.

Become an Agent

Warriors Lotto are always on the look out for new Agents to join the team. Do you know 10 family friends or work mates who would like to sign up to Lotto? If you do, you could become an Agent! Contact lotto@wiganwarriors.com to find out more.

The post Lotto 10k Draw LIVE appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.

entry.title: Singleton: Good foundations
entry.summary:
Brad Singleton gives an update on the pre-season schedule

The post Singleton: Good foundations appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
• Brad Singleton gives an update on the pre-season schedule as the Warriors gear up for the 2022 season.
  • Singleton: “I want us to be in a position where we can go and do some good stuff, and I want to be heavily involved in that.‚Äù
  • Hear more from Brad Singleton on Wigan TV, available HERE.

Brad Singleton talks pre-season, the mood in camp, new faces and personal aims for 2022 as he caught up with Wigan TV.

Singleton said: ‚ÄúI think the lads have been great, we‚Äôve all been waiting for it, ready to rip in. Obviously pre-season is a tough time, it‚Äôs enjoyable but also has it‚Äôs tough moments but with it being after Christmas you know the games are around the corner. You see others playing the Boxing Day friendly, see other people playing on Sundays and you get the itch again. The sooner it comes around, the better.‚Äù

The forward is in double figures for pre-season schedules but he admits it’s all about building the foundations: ‚ÄúIt comes around quick, I think this is my 12th pre-season full time in Super League so it does come around quick. No matter when you start, whether it‚Äôs October, November, December, once you get that slot it comes around rapid and before you know it, it‚Äôll be Round 10.

‚ÄúFor us, and for me personally it‚Äôs about hitting the ground running, nailing the friendlies ‚Äì that‚Äôs not saying wiping the floor with any team, it‚Äôs about ticking the right boxes and building the right foundations for a good year.‚Äù

He added: ‚ÄúI think we‚Äôre in a good place, we can‚Äôt win anything in pre-season but I think you can lose a season in pre-season, I can definitely say that hasn‚Äôt been done. This pre-season has set some good foundations, Matt [Peet] is a very smart bloke, he‚Äôs very respected within the camp and he‚Äôs got a hold of this group. He‚Äôs driving this culture, it‚Äôs working and everyone is buying in, for me that is everything.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll have to wait and see, I‚Äôm not going to say where we‚Äôll be at the end but we‚Äôll hopefully be capable for the big games.‚Äú

Singleton had plenty of praise for some of the new faces in the camp, as well as those who are familiar faces: ‚Äú[Patrick] Mago, [Kaide] Ellis and [Cade] Cust they‚Äôve all been great, they‚Äôve complimented the group. I think Mago and Ellis will bring something, there‚Äôs some physicality there, they‚Äôll bring something good and it will compliment our pack. The end game will be long, no matter what the competition for places, it‚Äôs great to have a little bit more experience in the pack, it‚Äôll benefit us all.

‚ÄúWith all the young lads or those who have got three, four, five seasons deep, it‚Äôll be good to see how they go. They‚Äôve got the experience now, they‚Äôve had the hurt and stuff like that which drives you, hopefully, the end product is great.‚Äù

The forward finished by laying down his aims for 2022: ‚ÄúFor me personally it‚Äôs about enjoying it, enjoying the ride. Obviously a few years ago I went through the stuff with Toronto and it‚Äôs just remembering and being grateful for where I am. I am doing that but also on the back of that I also want to be one of the most consistent forwards out there, that‚Äôll be my aim. I want us to be in a position where we can go and do some good stuff, and I want to be heavily involved in that.‚Äù

Make it Wigan in 2022 and celebrate our 150th year with a Wigan Warriors season ticket. Supporting Wigan is about more than just going to a game. It‚Äôs about something bigger, something special. It‚Äôs about playing our own individual role in helping the Club succeed. Buy your season ticket today. Click HERE for all the details.


The post Singleton: Good foundations appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.

We would like to say a massive thank you to everyone who has both sold and bought our tickets this year supporting Wigan Warriors Rugby League Youth Development once more and a huge congratulations to all the winners.

entry.title: Feature in our 150th year film
entry.summary:
Find out how you can get involved

The post Feature in our 150th year film appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
Would you like to be part of Wigan Warriors‚Äô special anniversary film which will commemorate the Club‚Äôs 150th year in 2022? If so, carry on reading to find out how you can get involved! 

We would like to say thank you to everyone who has been in touch and submitted their images and videos so far for the chance to be a part of the film. We have been overwhelmed by the response and the huge number of fantastic photos we have received! 

We are now looking for more videos to feature in the film. 

The video clips could be of you and anyone else watching a Wigan game. Do you have footage showing you and your loved ones celebrating a try or singing your heart out for the Warriors? If you do, we want to see it! 

You don‚Äôt need to worry about the quality or size ‚Äì taken on any mobile or video device is fine. Portrait or landscape is also fine. 

If you would like to send us a video, please note that you are confirming for us to use it as part of the 150th film and for us to share it on Wigan Warriors‚Äô social media. 

Please also note that we cannot guarantee that all the videos we receive will feature in the film, but we will endeavour to use as many as we can. 

If you would like the chance to be part of the film, please send your videos to 150@wiganwarriors.com. You can upload larger files by clicking HERE. 

The post Feature in our 150th year film appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.

entry.title: Last chance to register for Winter Warrior
entry.summary:
Our Winter Warrior programme returns across four Saturdays in January 2022, before the start of the 2022 season and there is only a few days left to register your child’s place. Registration ends at midnight on Friday 7th January, you can sign up HERE to take part with all the details below: The four-week training […]

The post Last chance to register for Winter Warrior appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
entry.content:
Our Winter Warrior programme returns across four Saturdays in January 2022, before the start of the 2022 season and there is only a few days left to register your child’s place.

Registration ends at midnight on Friday 7th January, you can sign up HERE to take part with all the details below:

The four-week training programme for boys and girls aged 9-14 will see participants train at Robin Park Arena, the home of Wigan Warriors. They will take part in a range of multi-disciplinary activities to improve the overall quality of their Rugby performance. From core skill to athletic development and game scenarios, each week the Wigan Warriors coaches will lead a range of activities that develop all of these areas.¬†

Each booking will include the following:

  • FREE junior 2022 season ticket.
  • FREE Winter Warrior training t-shirt.
  • Four weeks of high quality coaching (Saturday 8th, 15th, 22nd, 29th January).

For more information, please email¬†community@wiganwarriors.com

The post Last chance to register for Winter Warrior appeared first on Wigan Warriors Blog.
